ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
Class CiSS

java.lang.Object
  ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.AbstractResourceSelection
      ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.CiSS
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceSelection
Direct Known Subclasses:
CiSSApprox
public class CiSS
extends AbstractResourceSelection

Collection-integral Source Selection (CiSS) works as follows:

  1. A user's query is submitted to CSI.
  2. The retrieved documents are assigned to resources from which they originated. Sample document ranks are discarded and are replaced with intra-collection ranks. The last document in each resource is assumed to have the relevance score of 0 and the rank result_length * |resource_size|/|sample_size|.
  3. Document scores are transformed exponentially and ranks are transformed logarithmically.
  4. The score of each resource is calculated as an integral below the transformed score-rank curve.

Author:
Ilya Markov
See Also:
"Integral based source selection for uncooperative distributed information retrieval environments", Georgios Paltoglou, Michail Salampasisl and Maria Satratzemi. In Proceedings of LSDS-IR workshop, pages 67-74, 2008., "Modeling information sources as integrals for effective and efficient source selection", Georgios Paltoglou, Michail Salampasisl and Maria Satratzemi. Information Processing & Management, 47:1, pages 18-36, 2011.

Method Detail

getResourceScores

protected <T> Map<Resource,Double> getResourceScores(List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents,
                                                     List<Resource> resources)
Description copied from class: AbstractResourceSelection
Calculates scores for resources in resources based on the ranking of scored documents in documents. Returns a mapping between resources and their scores.

At this point scored documents must be sorted descending with respect to their scores.

This method must be overridden by subclasses.

Specified by:
getResourceScores in class AbstractResourceSelection
Parameters:
documents - The list of scored documents.
resources - The list of corresponding resources.
Returns:
The mapping between resources and their scores.
See Also:
AbstractResourceSelection.getResourceScores(List, java.util.List)

getResourceScore

protected <T> double getResourceScore(Resource resource,
                                      List<ScoredEntity<T>> documents)
Returns the score for a given resource based on its list of documents.

Can be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters:
resource - The resource.
documents - Its list of scored documents.
Returns:
The score for a given resource.
